body:
Hi Bi,

1. Check [this topic](www.grasshopper3d.com/xn/detail/2985220:Comment:1579727) for some explanations on your first question.
Also Ladybug Photovoltaics can calculate shading impact on the final energy output.

2. There are two ways to calculate optimal tilt and azimuth angles:
a) more precise, and slower one: by using Galapagos solver, and by iterating through tilt and azimuth angle sliders, until the optimal tilt and azimuth if found. Here is an [example video](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/video/annual-optimal-tilt-and-azimuth-angle-of-an-unshaded-pv-array), with [example definition](https://www.dropbox.com/s/p1bg0ved74sk983/optimal_tilt_azimuth_openRack.gh?dl=0).

b) less precise and quicker one: by using "Tilt and Orientation Factor (TOF)" component: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Vl6FuIcyK*vPCGivX**UEG0Yg-8Giap6*Y3DeJtzDDw3Up5exSeV3WbbakcikGH2vyiLJ6bYobGMxDRczFPBFtQFttmLYuXP/2b.jpg) Have in mind that the differences between 2)a) and 2)b) may mostly be less than 1 degree.
To calculate the minimal distance between PV rows (the "density you mentioned"), which will eliminate the [self shading](http://www.greenrhinoenergy.com/solar/performance/shading.php) from front PV rows, use the "PV SWH system size" component.
I attached an example definition for 2)b) option below along with minimal distance calculation.

Let us know if you have any other issue or question!
